synopsis: Chase and his two best friends Bren and Jinja arrive at one of Jeredy's laboratories. The father has gone missing, and Chase is looking for clues. Chase gets the Core and in the ensuing struggle, a desperate Chase "spins" Lock into existence.

Chase and his two compatriots steal a S.T.O.R.M. vehicle carrying Core Tech technology. They discover Chase's father had created a Monsuno called QUICKFORCE who is being held in the cold, scientific hands of S.T.O.R.M., and they're experimenting on him.

Our three heroes venture into the big city of Axistown to find any trail of Jeredy that they can. Our three meet up with a rich old woman who sends them into the "Underground" on Jeredy's trail. But, the Underground is a FIGHT CLUB for Monsuno.

When Chase receives a garbled message from his father asking to meet up, our hero can't resist. Our young hero heads out alone to an abandoned facility in search of his father only to meet up with Darkspin and Medea!
Our heroes travel to Mandala and to the Ancient LIBRARY of Tebab. A little knowledge would go a long way with our heroes at the moment. This is where they encounter a young controller named Beyal…
S.T.O.R.M. sets up a blockade in an attempt to not allow our four heroes out of Mandala. It's a game of cat and mouse, and the only way Chase and his compadres are going to make it out alive.
The teens are hiking through the Lowlands…following Dax, if he is going to really be a part of their team then Chase needs to find out what he is all about.
The teens are hiking through the Lowlands…following Dax, if he is going to really be a part of their team then Chase needs to find out what he is all about.

Dax has "joined" the team, but nobody is too happy about it. Chase still suspects Dax knows something about his father and asks about it. Dax denies all knowledge but did hear the old guy say something about Coastal City.

Dax is a trusted member of the group…well, he's not entirely trusted. Chase has been convinced by Beyal that Dax is supposed to be the fifth of the five. Things go from bad to worse when Dax not only sells them out but tries to help Charlemagne.
Chase and his "team" can't catch a break. They're being harassed. They're on the run. They can't sleep. They have barely eaten anything in three weeks. Tempers are flaring.

Chase and the others crash land in the jungle where they are joined by Jon Ace, freshly resigned from S.T.O.R.M. and on the run himself. But that's not the only surprise the jungle holds. Unbeknownst to them, they are being hunted by a hired killer.

Jon Ace leads the team to a mining operation where he, Jeredy and Klipse originally extracted and researched the meteor fragments, suggesting Chase might find a clue to his father's whereabouts there.

When Chase experiences a vision of a possible future where Monsuno have turned on humans, he becomes scared of Lock, which causes the Monsuno to sever the bond between them and flee. Away from his core, Lock's energy quickly fades.

During an intense battle with S.T.O.R.M. Soldiers, Chase and the team realize that the rift between Chase and LOCK has not fully healed. Beyal tells them of a Book in the Library of Tebab that could restore their connection and their relationship.

Chase has another one of his intense dreams only this time he doesn't believe it was just a dream. He thinks he's having visions about a massive natural disaster that is coming…the impending disaster caused by Monsuno!

When Chase has a dream about his mother, it really gets in his head. These dreams are much more like visions. He's really picking up the "Monsuno Sight" in a very big way. Conversely, Beyal's ability to see anything at all has gone away.

Desperately trying to regain his visions, which have pretty much been non-existent lately, Beyal tries to hard and loses it going into a catatonic state. Worried, Chase and the gang take Beyal to Tiger's Lair with Master Ey.

Searching for answers, Chase leads his crew back into the crystal-filled Cave of Convergence, the one they completely trashed in the previous episode. Using their Monsunos to clear the wreckage, they find a passage into a hidden valley.

Chase and the teens are taking advantage of their surroundings to get some food…via ice fishing. But what starts out as some fun and laughs turns into a life changing moment for Chase when Beyal has one of his visions. But this is a very special vision.

Chase and the teens are in Mandala looking for clues. They have to find Jeredy and put an end to all of this insanity once and for all. But, instead they find something just a little bit different when Dax finally comes clean about his top secret work.

When Jeredy Suno takes off in his mobile tractor trailer lab for an unknown reason, he attracts the attention of Darkspin and they go after him. Already on the trail of his father, Chase and the gang catch wind of this and resolve to do whatever it takes.
With Jeredy held in the cruel hands of Charlemagne and S.T.O.R.M., Chase has no other option than to plan a full-scale assault on Cloud Carrier Epsilon, Charlemagne's flagship.

When Jeredy and the Mon Five attempt to place the very last Failsafe Device deep down in the sewers of a dingy thief city named ISEMON they slowly begin to suspect that they're being followed. The team attempts to stay focused with the job at hand.

Chase and the teens are trying to figure out a way to rescue Jeredy and Ace, before it's too late from the cruel hands of Dr. Klipse! But, we soon learn it may already be too late. Because Klipse has revealed his ultimate plan to Jeredy...

Chase and the teens are right where we left them...in grave danger. Along with the Dawnmaster and One-Eyed Jack and his Desert Wolves...they are all trapped in the bottom half of what's left of Klipse's lab.
